rooms.name: Your Architext's Workshop
rooms.description: You find yourself in a large workshop in the middle of a vast, empty world. The workshop is filled with all the tools and materials you could ever need. A huge poster covers one of the wallsâ€”a brief intro on Architexture. A small manual hangs from a string at the bottom of the poster.

items.name: the Advanced Architexture Manual
items.description:
Manual on all the things that normal people can do:

- "look" to look at their surroundings.
- "look [item/exit]" to examine something in detail.
- "go [exit]" to use an exit.
- "items" to get a list of all obvious items in the room.
- "exits" to get a list of all obvious exits in the room.

Manual on all things that an architext can do:

- "craft" to create a new object.
- "build" to add a new room.
- "edit [item/exit]" to modify an object or an exit.
- "delete [item/exit]" to remove something permanently. âš  No undo!
- "info" to view details of your current room.
- "link" to connect two rooms with an exit.
- "remodel" to edit your current room.
- "raze" to delete your room and everything inside. ğŸš¨ No turning back!

âš  You can only use architext commands in a world you own.
